meanings.definition: Of or relating to an embryo.
meanings.sent1: The tiny bird had an embryonal beak, just like its parent.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the embryonal development of the frog.
meanings.sent3: The embryonal plant seemed to be shy, hiding behind the larger ones.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were still in an embryonal stage, waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The embryonal characteristics of the fish made it easy to identify.

meanings.definition: In an early stage of development.
meanings.sent1: The project was still in an embryonal phase, with much work to be done.
meanings.sent2: The city was once an embryonal settlement, now a bustling metropolis.
meanings.sent3: The embryonal idea of a flying car sounded both exciting and daunting.
meanings.sent4: Her skills in painting were embryonal, but showed great potential.
meanings.sent5: The embryonal buds on the tree promised a colorful spring ahead.

meanings.definition: Resembling an embryo in form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The creature had an embryonal appearance, with its small size and delicate features.
meanings.sent2: The newly discovered fossil had an embryonal shape, similar to that of a dinosaur.
meanings.sent3: The embryonal toy looked so cute, like a mini version of the real thing.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was embryonal, concise and full of potential.
meanings.sent5: The embryonal design of the building made it stand out among the rest.
